type.markdownDescription:
### How to Index GeoJSON Objects
The `geo` type can be used to index geographic points and shape coordinates. For this type, the indexed field must be a [GeoJSON](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/geojson/) object. You can use the [geoShape](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/atlas-search/geoShape/#std-label-geoshape-ref) and [geoWithin](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/atlas-search/geoWithin/#std-label-geowithin-ref) operators to query indexed fields of type `geo`.
type.description: Specify this data type for the indexing geographic points and shape coordinates.

indexShapes.markdownDescription:
### Choose whether to index shapes.
By default, Atlas Search:
- Indexes points, even when nested.
- Doesn't index shape geometries such as lines and polygons.

Value can be:
- `true` to index shapes and points
- `false` to index only points
